div.div: Drift and mixing concur to keep a high degree of worldwide homogeneity in the Emperor penguin.
div.p: All currently known Emperor penguin colonies 20 35 are represented by orange dots; sampled colonies by coloured circles. ( a) Estimated pairwise migration rates (outer coloured links) and Fst (inner dashed links) between sampled colonies. Migrations as estimated from joint allele-frequency spectra. Colours refer to the receiving populations (DDU, Pointe Géologie near Dumont D'Urville station; HAL, Halley Bay; MZW, Mertz West; MZE, Mertz East; NEU, Neumayer; WSH, Cape Washington). Dashed circle: Antarctic polar circle (S66°33'). ( b) Neighbour-net based on pairwise identity-by-state between all sampled individuals. Branch lengths represent pairwise Hamming distances. Colours correspond to colonies on map a.
